title: Cylinder Head - Installation

body.body: Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle Including locking devices
Warning - General - Stabilise Motorcycle - including DO NOT support on non integral parts
Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
Failure to follow the advice above could result in serious injury or death.
Note to be used in service manual with stabilise warning
Renew locking devices where specified, refer to
Before tightening a fixing using a crow foot spanner adapter, refer to
Use of Crow Foot Spanner Adapters with Torque Wrenches
Observe all torque wrench tightening procedures, refer to
D series 900 cc cylinder head Installation From VIN914448 D54; D64; D92; DA2; DB2; DB4; DBB; DC3; DC4; DCZ; DP2; DP3; DP4; DPZ
Thoroughly clean the upper faces of the cylinder barrel.
Refit the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade. Ensure the lower mounting tip is correctly located in the upper crankcase and the lugs are located in the barrel as noted during removal.
Camshaft drive chain tensioner rubbing blade
Ensure that both cylinder head dowels are correctly located in the cylinder barrel.
Position a new cylinder head gasket to the cylinder barrel, ensuring the gasket is fitted with the lettering uppermost and to the rear of the engine.
Position the cylinder head over the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade and locate it onto the dowels.
Put the new washers onto the new cylinder head bolts. Note that the Torx head bolt has a larger washer.
Lubricate only the threads of the bolts with new engine oil. Do not get oil on the washers or the heads of the bolts.
Tighten the cylinder head bolts in the steps and the correct sequence that follows.
If you do not use the correct procedure or replace all of the bolts, engine damage can occur or the life of the cylinder head gasket can be reduced.
Torque the new cylinder head bolts in the sequence that follows:
or a similar tool and tighten bolt 1 through an angle of
Tighten bolt 2 through an angle of
Tighten bolts 3 - 8 through an angle of
Carry out a torque over check of the bolts 1 to
Lubricate the valve shims with a 50/50 solution of molybdenum disulphide grease and engine oil, then refit them to their original locations in the cylinder head.

DCZ; DPZ; D64; D54; DC4; DC3; DP4; DP3; DP2; DPA; DP

body.body: Start the engine and allow it to idle while checking for air, oil, coolant and exhaust leaks.
